choices.text:
### System:
You are an AI assistant that follows instruction extremely well. Help as much as you can.

### User:
For libreoffice calc write an expression to copy contents from another cell and remove all single quotes

### Response:


To copy the contents of a cell in LibreOffice Calc, without removing any single quote characters, follow these steps:

1. Highlight or select the cells where you want to paste the data. 

2. Press `Ctrl + Shift + 't'`. This will open up the Data menu from which you can choose Copy Cells as Text.

3. The copied text will not contain single quotes, unless they are part of a string. If it contains multiple lines or if there's formatting in your original cell that has been lost during this operation, make sure to adjust these manually afterwards.
